examples.text: seven of Sweden’s top financial experts
Ten people were invited but only seven turned up.
Can you lend me seven dollars?
I can't read your writing—is this meant to be a seven?
The bulbs are planted in fives or sevens *(= groups of five or seven)*.
We moved to America when I was seven *(= seven years old)*.
Shall we meet at seven *(= at seven o'clock)*, then?

definitions.definition: in a confused state; not well organized

examples.text: I haven't had time to clear up, so I'm all at sixes and sevens.

definitions.definition: the desire for new sexual experience that is thought to be felt after seven years of marriage

wordOrigin: Old English seofon, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zeven and German sieben, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin septem and Greek hepta.
